title: UI-only admin gate + footer Admin quick link + visible Quote Requests in admin panel

requirements.summary: Hide admin panel content by default and unlock it only after clicking the Admin quick link and entering the correct password, without persisting unlock across refresh.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial page load, the admin panel content (AdminOrderManagementSection) is not rendered anywhere on the page.
Clicking the Admin quick link opens the admin password prompt modal.
Entering the exact password "PonytaPower17!" unlocks the admin panel and scrolls to the admin section.
Entering an incorrect password does not unlock the admin panel and shows an error message.
Refreshing the page does not automatically keep the admin panel unlocked (password must be entered again).

file_operations.description: Remove sessionStorage persistence for admin unlock (do not load/store 'admin_unlocked'); keep unlock state in-memory only so refresh always re-locks. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the password prompt modal continues to (1) validate only the exact hardcoded password "PonytaPower17!", (2) show an inline error on mismatch, and (3) unlock + smoothly scroll to the admin anchor after successful unlock. Keep using shadcn-ui Dialog primitives without modifying files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Confirm AdminOrderManagementSection is conditionally rendered only when the admin gate is unlocked, and keep a stable #admin anchor for scroll targeting. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add an Admin quick link in the footer that shares the same unlock/scroll behavior as the header Admin button.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer "Quick Links" section contains an "Admin" button/link.
When admin is locked, clicking the footer "Admin" quick link opens the password prompt modal.
When admin is already unlocked, clicking the footer "Admin" quick link scrolls smoothly to the admin section.

file_operations.description: Add an "Admin" entry to the footer Quick Links list. Wire it to the AdminGateContext: when locked call openPrompt(); when unlocked scroll smoothly to the existing #admin anchor (match header behavior, including any offset handling you apply). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refactor/align the admin click handler logic (if needed) so header Admin button and footer Admin quick link share the same behavior (prompt when locked; smooth scroll when unlocked). Keep using shadcn-ui Button without editing read-only UI component files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: In the unlocked admin panel, provide a Quote Forms/Quotes view that lists submitted quote requests from the public form with a clear empty state and authorization-aware error handling.
acceptanceCriteria: The admin panel includes a visible tab/section for quote requests (e.g., "Quote Forms" / "Quotes").
The quote requests view lists submitted tickets (name, email, message, category, status).
If there are no submitted tickets, the view shows an English empty state message.
The backend endpoint used to list tickets is admin-protected (rejects non-admin callers).

file_operations.description: Ensure the admin panel Tabs includes a clearly labeled "Quote Forms"/"Quotes" tab and that its content renders AdminQuoteFormsSection when selected. Keep the admin-only gating/denial UX consistent with the authorization componentâ€™s role checks already used in the admin panel. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Verify the quotes list shows the required fields (name, email, message, category, status/completed) and retains an English empty state message when there are no tickets. Improve unauthorized/error messaging as needed to clearly reflect admin-only access (pairing with the authorization component behavior). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Harden admin ticket query/mutation error handling for authorization failures (admin-protected backend function calls) so the UI can display a clear, English permission error when non-admin callers attempt to list/update tickets. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
